text.text_translated:
Marine means about the sea.  
Marine protected areas are special safe places in the sea.  
They protect the sea.  
Now they cover three out of one hundred of the sea.  
Lewis wants them to cover ten out of one hundred.  
He wants this to fix the damage to the sea.  
People catch too many fish.  
People make the water dirty.  
People throw trash into the sea.  
Lewis saw this on his trips.  
He swam over coral reefs.  
The reefs turned white because the water got hotter.  
He also saw empty places in the Red Sea.  
Those places had no life.  
They were full of plastic.  
Pugh thinks nature can get better.  
It needs space.  
Time is short.  
We must protect the sea.  
If we do not protect the sea, a big5 problem will happen.  
The problem may become unsolvable.

best_attempt.text_translated:
Marine protected areas are safe parts of the ocean.  
Lewis wants more marine protected areas.  
He wants them to rise from three to ten percent.  
He hopes this will stop the harm caused by people.  

People catch too many fish.  
People make the water dirty.  
People throw trash into the sea.  

Lewis saw this harm on his trips.  
He swam over coral reefs that turned white because the water got hotter.  
He also saw empty places near the surface of the Red Sea.  
Those places had no life and were full of plastic.  

Pugh thinks nature can get better if it has room.  
But time is running out.  

If we do not care for the sea, a problem will appear.  
We cannot solve it.
